properties.description: "A sustainability program for coffee, cocoa and tea working together with existing brands. Farmers are enabled to improve their productivity, product quality and efficiency with care for people and environment. This allows them to produce higher volumes at lower costs which raises the standard of living of the farming communities. Consumers can enjoy their favorite brand and simultaneously contribute to a sustainable world."
properties.address: De Ruyterkade 6, 1013 AA Amsterdam, The Netherlands
properties.title: UTZ Certified organization

properties.description: The Port of Oakland became one of the largest ports in the world in the 1960’s with the innovation of shipping containers, allowing the port to ship and receive goods from around the world. Without this product, shipping coffee would be impossible. Now the majority of specialty coffee is imported through Oakland.
properties.address: Port of Oakland, 530 Water St, Oakland, CA 94607, USA
properties.title: Port of Oakland

properties.description:
Founded in 1997 in Columbus, OH, moved to California in 2002.
Coffee importers, roasters, green bean wholesale and retailers, as well as an educational source.
Support Fair Trade, Organic and Sustainable practicing farms.
properties.title: Sweet Maria's

properties.description:
Coffee farm, at around 1600m elevation. Kenyan coffee is known for its high quality control and excellent "bright coffee that lights up the palate from front to back" (SM). Specific types of coffee - not
blends - are sold in lots at auction. Buyers are usually either smaller roasters like Sweet Maria's, or traders who then sell the coffee to exporters, or mills and
then exporters, who in turn sell to large companies like Folger's. Sweet Maria's says "[w]hen we go after an auction lot, 9 out of 10 times we buy the whole thing; it is exclusively ours" as opposed to being split up by a trader or co-op. Direct buying is often more equitable than a co-op or trader (see video). Political unrest does affect the market significantly. If "the auction system does not continue to serve and benefit the small farmer co-ops, they will plant other crops instead.
http://www.sweetmarias.com/travelogues/KenyaMarch2009/KenyaCommentsFromAQuickVisit2009.html
properties.title: Kagumo-ini Coffee Farm
Tekangu Farmers Cooperative Society
properties.description:
Over 3,100 farms participating.
Benefits include improved social and environmental impact through participation, training and education, UTZ certification (sustainable practices), some financial resources, community, access to technology, access to auction lots, and improved pricing for their product.

properties.title: US Postal Service
properties.address: 475 L'Enfant Plaza SW, Washington, DC 20024, USA

properties.title: Ministry of Agriculture
properties.description:
Core functions:
Formulation, implementation and monitoring of agricultural legislation's, regulations and policies.
Provision of agricultural extension services.
Supporting agricultural research and promoting delivery.
Facilitating and representing agricultural state corporations in the Government.
Development, implementation and coordination of programmes in the agriculture sector.
Regulating and quality control of inputs, produce and products from the agriculture sector.
Management and control of pests and diseases in crops.
Promoting management and conservation of the natural resource base for agriculture.
Collecting, maintaining and managing information on the agriculture sector.

Services:
Agricultural extension
Crop development
Agricultural policy review and coordination
Agricultural development coordination

Support to and facilitation:
Agricultural research and technical training
Agricultural land management
Agri-business and promotion
Agricultural market development

properties.title: Kenya Coffee Board
properties.description:
Formulate policies and rules to regulate and develop the coffee industry in consultation with the Ministry of Agriculture.
Carry out registration and licensing of coffee nurseries, growers, pulping stations, millers, marketing agents, management agents, buyers, roasters, packers, warehousemen and auctioneers to ensure adherence to standards.
Provide advisory services related to coffee production and quality enhancement.
Collect, collate, analyse data, maintain a database on the coffee industry and document and monitor it through registration of any persons dealing with coffee.
Represent the Government in international fora in regard to coffee matters.
Arbitrate in case of any disputes in the industry.
Encourage environmentally friendly, ethical and hygienic coffee production, processing and marketing practices, in order to enhance quality of coffee and sustainability.
Identify, develop and promote new and emerging domestic and global markets

properties.title: Kenya Planters Cooperative Union Ltd
properties.description:
Marketing agency for Kenya coffee industry. The KPCU was formed in 1937 to represent the interests of small farmers. However it took on dual status as a private company and a non-profit union in 1941 when it purchased the Nairobi Curing Company. This dual status raised conflict of interest questions that remain today.

The revival of the collapsed Kenya Planters Co-operative Union-KPCU has began taking shape after the government inaugurated a new interim board elected by farmers at a Special General Meeting two weeks ago. The 7 member board will now have the task of negotiating with the receiver managers on modalities of repaying outstanding debts and appoint a new management board to run the daily affairs of the giant coffee marketing agency.
--Denis Otieno

properties.title: Port of Mombasa
properties.description:
The Port provides direct connectivity to over 80 Ports worldwide.
Coffee is shipped via large containers on shipping vessels to destinations around the world.

properties.title: Dormans Coffee Exporters
properties.description:
Founded in 1950, operate roasteries, coffeehouses, and participate in production and export of coffee.
"Our mission is to strengthen communities through every cup of exceptional coffee."
